intro: Hirtella sapinii var. greenwayi, commonly known as the greenway's hirtella, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded understory environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and foliage, which contribute to its common name. This variant is notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
